qas.question: How many Catholic high schools are in Detroit?
How many Catholic grade schools are in Detroit?
On which side of the city of the city are all of the Catholic schools located?
Two of the three Catholic high schools are operated by which religious group?

context: Detroit is served by various private schools, as well as parochial Roman Catholic schools operated by the Archdiocese of Detroit. As of 2013[update] there are <a1_0>four<a1_0/> Catholic grade schools and <a0_0>three<a0_0/> Catholic high schools in the City of Detroit, with all of them in the city's <a2_0>west<a2_0/> side. The Archdiocese of Detroit lists a number of primary and secondary schools in the metro area as Catholic education has emigrated to the suburbs. Of the three Catholic high schools in the city, two are operated by the <a3_0>Society of Jesus<a3_0/> and the third is co-sponsored by the Sisters, Servants of the Immaculate Heart of Mary and the Congregation of St. Basil.
